title: 2 Easy Ways to Disable Norton Antivirus on Your Computer

steps.title: Find the Norton product icon in the taskbar.
steps.content: Find the Norton product icon in the taskbar. This looks like a black checkmark with a yellow background. You can find this icon in the bottom-right corner of the screen. Click the up arrow to expand the system tray. [1] X Research source To temporarily turn off Norton Antivirus, you must be logged onto your computer with an Administrator account . If you aren't, some settings may be disabled. If you want to completely remove Norton Antivirus, you'll need to uninstall it from your computer.

steps.title: Right-click the Norton icon.
steps.content: Right-click the Norton icon. A menu will open.

steps.title: Click Disable Auto-Protect.
steps.content: Click Disable Auto-Protect . If this option is greyed out, this means Norton had detected and repaired a threat on your computer. Restart your computer , and then try again. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select the duration.
steps.content: Select the duration. You can turn off Auto-Protect for 15 minutes , 1 hour , 5 hours , Until system restart , or Permanently . If you don't see the duration you want, click More Options .

steps.title: Right-click the Norton icon again, and click Disable Smart Firewall.
steps.content: Right-click the Norton icon again, and click Disable Smart Firewall . This is below Auto-Protect .

steps.title: Select the duration.
steps.content: Select the duration. You can turn off Auto-Protect for 15 minutes , 1 hour , 5 hours , Until system restart , or Permanently . [3] X Research source If you don't see the duration you want, click More Options . Norton Antivirus will be disabled. Unless you selected Permanently , Norton should automatically enable these features again after the specified time. To enable it again, right-click the Norton icon and click Enable .

steps.title: Turn off Task Notifications (optional).
steps.content: Turn off Task Notifications (optional). If you only want to disable Norton's notifications, do the following: [4] X Research source Launch your Norton application. On the "My Norton" window, click Open next to "Device Security". Click Settings . Click Administrative Settings . Toggle off Norton Task Notification . Click Apply and then Close .

steps.title: Launch your Norton application.
steps.content: Launch your Norton application. This looks like a black checkmark with a yellow background. If the My Norton window opens, click Open next to Device Security .

steps.title: Click Advanced.
steps.content: Click Advanced . This will be in Norton's main product window. You may see Settings instead. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Click Protect My Mac.
steps.content: Click Protect My Mac . You can find this on the left panel. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle off "Automatic Scans".
steps.content: Toggle off "Automatic Scans". The switch will turn grey.

steps.title: Click Firewall.
steps.content: Click Firewall . A new window will open.

steps.title: Toggle off "Connection Blocking".
steps.content: Toggle off "Connection Blocking". The switch will turn grey.

steps.title: Toggle off "Vulnerability Protection".
steps.content: Toggle off "Vulnerability Protection". The switch will turn grey. [7] X Research source Norton Antivirus is now disabled. If you want to completely remove Norton Antivirus , you'll need to uninstall it from your computer.
